byline.contributor: Falih Hassan reported from Baghdad, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By FALIH HASSAN and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Islamic State releases recording of speech group claims was made by leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, calling on more Muslims to join extremist cause; audio release follows reports Baghdadi was either killed or severely wounded.
lead_paragraph: In a recorded speech, whose authenticity could not be confirmed, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi implored more Muslims to fight on behalf of his group.

headline.main: ISIS, Facing Losses, Releases Recording Said to Be of Leader
headline.print_headline: Confronting Losses, ISIS Issues Recording Said to Be of Leader

snippet: In a recorded speech, whose authenticity could not be confirmed, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi implored more Muslims to fight on behalf of his group.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
